meanings.definition: A photographic process in which a positive image is made by a negative image on paper coated with silver iodide.
meanings.sent1: The calotype captured the beautiful scenery on paper.
meanings.sent2: I have a calotype of my family hanging on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The calotype of the cat wearing sunglasses made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a calotype of joy, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The calotype of the sunset was so vivid, it felt like you could touch the colors.

meanings.definition: A photograph made by the calotype process.
meanings.sent1: He showed me a calotype of his new puppy.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various calotypes from the 19th century.
meanings.sent3: The calotype of the cake looked almost good enough to eat.
meanings.sent4: His words were a calotype of wisdom, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The calotype of the old tree captured its strength and resilience.
